text: thumb Here are the Billboard magazine Hot 100 number one hits of 1968. That year, 10 acts hit number one for the first time, such as John Fred and His Playboy Band, The Lemon Pipers, Paul Mauriat, Otis Redding, Bobby Goldsboro, Archie Bell & the Drells, Herb Alpert, Hugh Masekela, Jeannie C. Riley, and Marvin Gaye. Otis Redding, after his death in late 1967, was the first artist to hit number one posthumously. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" |+Key |style="background-color:#FFFF99"|The yellow background indicates the #1 song on Billboard's 1968 Year-End Chart of Pop Singles. |} {| class="wikitable" ! width=31| !Issue date !Song !Artist(s) !Reference |- | bgcolor=#EDEAE0 align=center
